body: This assumes `T` has a default constructor, which might not be the case. You can simply change the code below to do `lock.unlock()` once you're done. It would be nice if we could have a test with a data type that can't be default constructed.
body_html: This assumes T has a default constructor, which might not be the case. You can simply change the code below to do lock.unlock() once you're done. It would be nice if we could have a test with a data type that can't be default constructed.
body_text: This assumes T has a default constructor, which might not be the case. You can simply change the code below to do lock.unlock() once you're done. It would be nice if we could have a test with a data type that can't be default constructed.
